title: Overcoming Perceptual Limitations
content: Human perception has limits: attention blindness, change blindness, and expectation bias all affect what we see. You can look directly at something and not perceive it if you're expecting something different or focused elsewhere. Acknowledge these limits and use techniques to compensate: verbalize observations, use checklists, and cross-check with teammates.

mcq.question: You're looking for a specific valve tag number. You scan a row of valves and don't see it. What should you consider before moving on?

options.B: You may have missed it due to attention blindnessâ€”scan again more slowly
options.C: Ask someone else where it is

mcq.explanation: Attention blindness can cause you to look directly at something and not see it. Before concluding the valve isn't there, slow down and search deliberately rather than scanning quickly.

openQuestions: When has expectation bias caused you to miss something that was right in front of you?
What techniques help you overcome perceptual limitations in your work?
